plotSummary.brief: Pandora's wildlife swarms from forest in unprecedented coordinated assault, attacking RDA forces. Eywa answers Jake's prayer. Nature fights back. Battle turns.
plotSummary.detailed: Ground troops detect 'something coming'—'all lit up out there' on thermal screens. Ground shaking. Slow building thunderous ROAR. Wall of charging HAMMERHEADS crashes out of foliage in shower of broken branches. Stampede drives over AMP suits like wave—tree-trunk feet shattering cockpits, crushing troopers. VIPERWOLVES race among foot-soldiers with flashing jaws—survivors break and run. HUNDREDS of riderless WILD BANSHEES converge on Quaritch's ships, literally darkening sky. Jake banks watching—'What the hell—?' Wild banshees wheel among ships, ripping into them. ON JAKE—slowly getting it: 'EYWA is in the fight!' Celebrating—'WHOO-HOOOO!' Gunner fires from Samson door—banshee head lunges in, jerking him out. Neytiri watches ground troops scatter in disarray—viperwolves flash past her, ignoring her. She senses something and turns: THANATOR emerging from smoke behind her—glistening black demon. Stands paralyzed before its gaze—and thanator LOWERS itself, head to ground, waiting. Trembling, Neytiri approaches. Thanator accepts her as rider. Wainfleet and AMP suits charging through smoky gloom—panicked radio chatter. Something slams other suit out of frame. Wainfleet finds squad-mate's suit ripped open, blood inside, driver gone. Thanator LEAPING straight at him—Wainfleet raises cannon but WHAM—it's on him, slamming to ground. Neytiri on its back. Thanator rears back, slams teeth through canopy. Wainfleet's scream brief. Neytiri's demon mount roars triumphant echo through forest. Mo'at at Tree of Souls opens eyes in sudden realization—Eywa has answered. Battle turns to rout. Troopers fleeing, calling for extraction. Animals attacking with unprecedented coordination. RDA forces disintegrating. Ecosystem's immune response destroying invasion.
plotSummary.subtext: Eywa answering Jake's prayer from Scene 34—looking through Grace's memories, seeing Earth's ecological death, understanding existential threat humans pose, mobilizing planetary defense; ecosystem as conscious agent protecting balance not individuals (as Neytiri warned); Pandora's immune system attacking invaders like antibodies destroying disease; animals acting with coordinated intelligence—not random but directed; unprecedented behavior showing divine intervention not natural occurrence; nature fighting back against technology—organic versus mechanical; validating Na'vi theology—Eywa real, active, capable of intervention; Jake's faith vindicated—'probably just talking to a tree' proven wrong; Neytiri's teaching—'protects only balance of life'—demonstrated; humans as ecological threat triggering planetary response; colonialism meeting resistance from planet itself not just people; deus ex machina justified through earlier setup (prayer, theology, Grace's upload); miracle earned through sacrifice (Trudy, Tsu'tey) and faith (Jake praying despite doubt); turning point from hopeless defeat to possible victory; technology insufficient against planetary consciousness; Western/human assumptions about nature (passive, resource, exploitable) shattered by active ecological agency; Gaia hypothesis made literal—planet as organism defending itself.

scenes.significance: CRITICAL TURNING POINT—battle shifts from RDA victory to Na'vi survival; validates Eywa's existence and agency—not myth but reality; proves Jake's prayer (Scene 34) was heard and answered; demonstrates Na'vi theology correct—Eywa protects balance when threatened; shows Grace's sacrifice meaningful—her memories uploaded to Eywa provided evidence of human ecological threat; establishes nature as active protagonist not passive backdrop; defeats technology through coordinated organic response; vindicates Jake's faith—praying despite doubt, Eywa responding despite Neytiri's warning she doesn't take sides; reveals Eywa does intervene when ecosystem itself threatened—not favoritism but self-preservation; thematic culmination—nature versus technology, organic versus mechanical, indigenous theology versus colonial materialism; Neytiri riding thanator—deadliest predator submitting to her, showing Eywa's blessing; Wainfleet killed by nature after torturing Tsu'tey—poetic justice; RDA forces routed—technical superiority overcome by planetary will; sets up final confrontation—Quaritch surviving, continuing mission despite divine opposition; proves indigenous peoples' connection to land is real power not primitive superstition; earned miracle—setup through theology, prayer, sacrifice; not deus ex machina but deus ex doctrina (god from doctrine); audience catharsis—finally seeing Na'vi gain advantage; hope restored after despair

plotSummary.brief: Quaritch attacks Jake's human body; Neytiri saves Jake and kills Quaritch. RDA defeated and exiled. Jake's consciousness permanently transfers to Na'vi body. Transformation complete.
plotSummary.detailed: Quaritch in AMP suit attacks link station. Neytiri kills him with arrow through heart, saves Jake. RDA surrenders, survivors exiled to Earth. At Tree of Souls, Jake's consciousness permanently transfers to avatar body. Human body dies peacefully. Jake wakes as Na'vi. 'I See you.' Home found. Voiceover: aliens returned to dying world; if they come back, we'll be ready.
plotSummary.subtext: Complete transformation; death and rebirth; belonging earned; colonialism defeated but threat remains.
